channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australia records lowest number of COVID-19 cases in 24-hour period since early March, US death toll passes 45,000, Australia's death toll stands at 74

item.description: The mood benefits of exercise can linger for weeks after people stop working out, offering another compelling reason for us to try to move, whenever we still can, during this coronavirus crisis.
item.title: How many times a week you should exercise to see real mood benefits

item.description: The former New York City mayor will contribute at least $US10 million to create a "tracing army" that will help find people infected with the coronavirus.
item.title: Mike Bloomberg to help create 'tracing army' to tame New York outbreak

item.description: Other Fox executives will also forgo their salaries until September to protect the company's full-time employees during the health crisis, the Murdochs said.
item.title: Rupert and Lachlan Murdoch to forgo salaries due to hit from coronavirus

item.description: The thief can be seen hurrying through the museum gift shop with a Vincent van Gogh painting tucked under his right arm and the sledgehammer in his left hand.
item.title: Video shows thief stole van Gogh painting with sledgehammer

item.description: Take a deep breath Sydney because your city's air hasn't been this clean since at least the end of 2017 but those clear skies might not last much longer.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Virus and favourable weather delivers clear skies

item.description: Follow our live coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Retail leap spurs local index, but Macquarie analysts warn stock valuations remain high.
item.title: Retail leap spurs ASX to flat finish

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Large totals of water available for irrigation contradict claims from NSW Deputy Premier John Barilaro that farmers had been sacrificed for the environmental objectives of the "failed" Murray Darling Basin Plan.
item.title: Commonwealth warns against 'illegal' water diversion sought by Barilaro

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 23, 2020

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australia will on Thursday call for an international review of wildlife markets as it also leads a push for the World Health Organisation to be given the power to forcibly enter a country.
item.title: Morrison calls for ban on wildlife markets and 'weapons inspector' powers for WHO

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The urban projects are a small step towards sprucing up areas along one of the city's biggest eyesores.
item.title: Sydney's inner west gets $20m for cycleways to revitalise open spaces

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: In the Wallabies captains group, rugby players have found an independent and respected group to help deliver the "transformation" they have spoken of for weeks.
item.title: Wallabies captains, players union to mine history for rugby's future

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Melbourne Airport has made a bold pitch to become Virgin Australia's new home base, arguing the collapsed airline must walk away from its Brisbane base.
item.title: Melbourne Airport pitches to become Virgin's home base

item.dc:creator: Lissa Christopher
item.description: Two talented but inexperienced screen actors have captured the passionate bond that's central to the acclaimed novel.
item.title: Chemistry is key to the TV adaptation of Sally Rooney's Normal People

item.dc:creator: Matt Kean
item.description: The NSW Minister for Energy and Environment defends the right of the former prime minister to write his account of his time in office.
item.title: To my Liberal colleagues seeking Malcolm Turnbull's expulsion: you do not own our party

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: Jocelyn Moorhouse, Christos Tsiolkas and Debra Oswald are among those backing Kim Williams' call for increased support of the arts.
item.title: Leading culture figures back call for government support

item.description: Germany, on the other hand, has followed expert advice, but then Chancellor Angela Merkel is herself a scientist.
item.title: Trump joins 'Ostrich Alliance' of loser leaders

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: The head of the peak insolvency body says one element of the Deloitte report is sure to raise eyebrows in the sector.
item.title: Deloitte's Virgin work raises eyebrows as challenge looms

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Experts say COVID-19 could inflict lasting damage on the body's organs, impairing the lung and heart functions of those who become critically ill with the disease.
item.title: Coronavirus could impair organs of those infected for 'months and years'

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Take a deep breath Sydney because your city's air hasn't been this clean since at least the end of 2017 but those clear skies might not last much longer.
item.title: Virus and favourable weather delivers clear skies over Sydney

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Nib boss Mark Fitzgibbon said the shutdown of elective procedures meant the company expected a significant reduction in claims, meaning savings that could be passed on to members.
item.title: Nib chief flags rebates amid 'abnormal' profit boost

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, April 23

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: First State CEO Deanne Stewart says the coronavirus could be a catalyst for mergers as small or underperforming funds struggle to cope with the wave of cash withdrawals.
item.title: Coronavirus could be catalyst for fund mergers, says First State chief

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: Confronted by the GFC, a former Treasury secretary designed tax reforms to transform the economy. They're still on the shelf, but we need to dust them off.
item.title: Our roadmap out of this economic crisis was delivered 12 years ago

item.description: What message do the shareholders of a large company send when they will not support their company in its hour of need?
item.title: Airline monopoly a one-way ticket to trouble

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: Paw Patrol, Paw Patrol, do we always have to watch Paw Patrol?
item.title: Top 5 kids' cartoons that parents won't hate

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: A pristine Sydney headland is at the centre of the dispute, as activists call for the burn to be scaled back.
item.title: 'It just destroys everything': battle ignites over hazard reduction burn

item.description: Long-past prime ministers saw the need to support Australia's creative arts, but now our funding is much diminished on the world stage, writes the chairman of the Copyright Agency.
item.title: Our creative community's collapse is without precedent: the case for a 40% funding boost

item.dc:creator: Jacqui Martinez
item.description: 24,500 hear Billy Graham, bid to ban Saturday shopping and police rough-handle Castro.
item.title: In the Herald: April 23, 1959

item.description: On April 23, 2005, Sir Joh Bjelke-Petersen died aged 94. Tony Stephens remembers the "populist radical of the right" who ruled Queensland for 19 years.
item.title: From the Archives, 2005: Farewell, Sir Joh, the great divider

item.description: The US President tweeted that he had instructed the US Navy to open fire if US ships were harassed, in a move likely to stoke further tension between the US and Iran.
item.title: Trump instructs US Navy to shoot at Iranian gunboats 'if they harass our ships at sea'

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: No wonder Treasurer Josh Frydenberg picked Nicholas Moore to be the government's eyes and ears in the Virgin collapse.
item.title: Bankers gather to play their part in Virgin's resurrection

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Cricket Australia boss Kevin Roberts has conceded it would be almost impossible to stage the World Cup as scheduled under current travel restrictions.
item.title: Twenty 20 World Cup could be pushed back until next February

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: A new model of family services care will be unveiled by government on Thursday, linking vulnerable children and young people to staff, resources and services.
item.title: Multimillion-dollar package to support kids through COVID-19 crisis

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Former South Australian leader Jay Weatherill has warned children are being failed by a fractured system led by private interests.
item.title: Ex-premier urges states to take over childcare system in 'crisis'

item.dc:creator: Tony Wright
item.description: The village of Eurack has disappeared, leaving Victoria's oldest Avenue of Honour to sit isolated, a monument to the great Australian loneliness.
item.title: State's oldest Avenue of Honour sits isolated, a symbol of the times

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: Police will be barred from accessing metadata in the new coronavirus app, after the Attorney-General vowed regulatory action.
item.title: Attorney-General to ban police from accessing coronavirus app metadata

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Four police have been killed in a multi-vehicle crash on the Eastern Freeway in the single largest loss of police life in one incident in the state’s history.
item.title: Four police officers killed in horror crash on Eastern Freeway

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Australia records lowest COVID-19 case numbers in 24 hours since early March, Ruby Princess scheduled to depart Port Kembla on Thursday as nation's death toll stands at 74

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, April 23

item.description: Chief Commissioner Graham Ashton has provided an account of the events leading up to Wednesday night tragedy on the Eastern Freeway
item.title: 'A large truck has driven into these officers': Top cop describes horror crash

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Doctors say the lack of recognition of GPs as frontline health providers meant they were "held up by red tape" during the summer's catastrophic bushfires.
item.title: 'Held up by red tape': GPs demand changes to ensure they can help in disasters

item.description: Flu shot expeditions revive old teenage feelings.
item.title: Hopping for joy over a cold shoulder surprise

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: Troubled former footballer Ben Cousins is back behind bars after he was reportedly arrested with drugs in his possession in a southern Perth suburb on Wednesday.
item.title: Ben Cousins back behind bars after being found sleeping next to a car

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The Queensland Symphony Orchestra's Jill Atkinson thought she would never see her family's unusual 100-year-old harp again.
item.title: Chat turns up harpist's long-lost family heirloom 40 years on

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Diamond nanothreads developed by Queensland researchers are able to store energy at three times the rate of a lithium-ion battery.
item.title: Diamonds are a scientist's best friend for cutting-edge energy storage

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Council's Night-Time Economy committee will work to prevent the city's night life from becoming a "laughing stock" like Sydney's, says lord mayor.
item.title: New Brisbane committee to bolster city's live music venues
